bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names gan ji 疳疾 , gan -ailment; gan bing 疳病 , gan- disease ; gan qi 疳氣 , gan- illness qi; gan shou 疳瘦 , gan- illness with emaciation. Pathological Condition of a chronic malnutrition disease resulting from various causes that harm the spleen and stomach and disturb their functions. The major sign is physical depletion, weakness, and emaciation. It may assume numerous different manifestations, each of which has a specific designation. Until the Tang, this was generally considered a disease affecting adults and children alike. Beginning with the Song, this gradually developed into a disease diagnosed in children only. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 4: 蒸盛，過傷內則變為疳 , “Excessive steaming harming the interior will change into gan- illness ”.
